clinical_study.brief_title: The Modular Protocol for Mental Health (MPMH)
clinical_study.official_title: The Modular Protocol for Mental Health (MPMH): A Pilot Randomised Clinical Trial of a Transdiagnostic Psychological Treatment for Mood and Anxiety Disorders in Adults

lead_sponsor.agency: Medical Research Council Cognition and Brain Sciences Unit

collaborator.agency: Cambridgeshire and Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust

clinical_study.source: Medical Research Council Cognition and Brain Sciences Unit

brief_summary.textblock:
Currently, our best psychological treatments for anxiety and mood disorders only focus on individual diagnoses. So, there are separate treatments for Panic Disorder, or Depressive Disorder, or Social Anxiety, etc. These 'diagnosis-specific' treatments work well for people whose problems fit neatly into a single diagnosis. However, they work far less well for people with complex problems involving multiple diagnoses, and 50% of patients fail to respond well to these existing treatments.
The purpose of this study is to test a new psychological treatment for anxiety and mood problems (the Modular Protocol for Mental Health [MPMH]). Instead of focusing on any single diagnosis, MPMH combines the best treatment techniques into 10 modules to target problems common across all of the different mood and anxiety diagnoses (e.g., intense emotions, negative thinking, upsetting memories, distressing habits). MPMH should therefore be a better treatment for the large numbers of individuals whose problems do not fit neatly into a single diagnosis and for whom any treatments targeting a single diagnosis would leave significant difficulties unaddressed.

study_design_info.masking_description: Only the outcome assessor will be masked, as this is a psychological intervention it is not possible to mask the participant, care provider or investigator.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
primary_outcome.description: Patient Health Questionnaire - 9-item version (PHQ-9; Kroenke & Spitzer, 2002)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
primary_outcome.description: General Anxiety Disorder Questionnaire - 7-item version (GAD-7; Spitzer, Kroenke, Williams, & Lowe, 2006)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Level of disability and functional impairment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
primary_outcome.description: Work and Social Adjustment Scale (WSAS; Mundt, J.C. et al., 2002)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of social phobia, agoraphobia and specific phobia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: IAPT Phobia Scales (Department of Health/IAPT, 2011). This measure will only be completed by participants with symptoms of social phobia, agoraphobia or specific phobia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of social anxiety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: The Social Phobia Inventory (SPIN; Connor, Davidson, Churchill, Sherwood, Foa, & Weisler, 2000). This measure will only be completed by participants with symptoms of social anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of generalised anxiety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: The Penn State Worry Questionnaire (PSWQ; Meyer, Miller, Metzger, & Borkovec, 1990). This measure will only be completed by participants with symptoms of generalised anxiety disorder.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: The Obsessive-Compulsive Inventory (OCI; Foa, Kozak, Salkovskis, Coles, & Amir, 1998). This measure will only be completed by participants with symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: The Revised Impact of Event Scale (IES-R; Weiss, 2007). This measure will only be completed by participants with symptoms of PTSD.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: The Agoraphobia-Mobility Inventory (MI; Chambless, Caputo, Jasin, Gracely, & Williams, 1985). This measure will only be completed by participants with symptoms of agoraphobia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of specific phobias
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: The Fear Questionnaire (FQ; Marks & Mathews, 1979). This measure will only be completed by participants with symptoms of specific phobia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of panic disorder
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: The Panic Disorder Severity Scale - self report version (PDSS-SR; Shear, Brown, Barlow, Money, Sholomskas, Woods, Gorman, & Papp, 1997). This measure will only be completed by participants with symptoms of panic disorder.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of illness anxiety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: The Health Anxiety Inventory - short version (SHAI; Salkovskis, Rimes, Warwick, & Clark, 2002). This measure will only be completed by participants with symptoms of illness anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in level of disability and functional impairment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in expectancy about treatment outcome, as well as the credibility of the treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: The Treatment Credibility / Expectancy Questionnaire (CEQ; Devilly & Borkovec, 2000)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in ability to contextualize negative events within a wider frame of reference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: Cognitive Emotion Regulation Questionnaire (CERQ; Garnefski, Kraaij & Spinhoven, 2000)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in disengagement from and acceptance of troublesome mental content, rumination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensity with which participants experience 36 different emotions on a typical day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in personality functioning on four subscales: Identity, Self-Direction, Empathy, and Intimacy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: Levels of Personality Functioning Scale (LPFS; Morey et al., 2017)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in use of NHS services, other mental health services or activities, help at home, and time off work/lost income
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: Healthlines Resource Use Questionnaire (Salisbury, O'Cathain, Edwards, Thomas, Gaunt, Hollinghurst, et al., 2016)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life assessment of health and wellbeing, daily functioning, and general life satisfaction across multiple domains
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session, three-months following final treatment session
secondary_outcome.description: World Health Organisation (WHO) Quality of Life Inventory (WHOQOL; World Health Organisation, 1998)

other_outcome.measure: Change in measure of memory specificity
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session

other_outcome.measure: Change in cognitive flexibility for emotional information
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session
other_outcome.description: Affective Card Sorting Task (Barcelo, 2003; Deveney & Deldin, 2006)

other_outcome.measure: Change in immediate recall and working memory for neutral information
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session

other_outcome.measure: Change in brief measure of premorbid intelligence
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session

other_outcome.measure: Change in emotional structure (awareness and differentiation)
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session
other_outcome.description: Levels of Emotional Awareness Scale (Lane et al., 1990)

other_outcome.measure: Change in potential neurobiomarkers that may account for risk of disorders and/or predict treatment response (optional component of participation)
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within two weeks of first treatment session), within one week of the final treatment session
other_outcome.description: Functional connectivity during resting state MRI

other_outcome.time_frame: Within one-week pre-delivery of relevant treatment module; within one-week post-delivery of relevant treatment module (varied time-frame)
other_outcome.description: Ruminative Responses Scale of the Response Styles Questionnaire (RRS; Treynor, Gonzalez, Nolen-Hoeksema, 2003)

other_outcome.measure: Change in ability to tolerate distress
other_outcome.time_frame: Within one-week pre-delivery of relevant treatment module; within one-week post-delivery of relevant treatment module (varied time-frame)

other_outcome.measure: Change in ability to label, perceive, and regulate emotions
other_outcome.time_frame: Within one-week pre-delivery of relevant treatment module; within one-week post-delivery of relevant treatment module (varied time-frame)
other_outcome.description: Difficulties with Emotion Regulation Scale (DERS; Gratz & Roemer, 2004)

other_outcome.measure: Change in negative beliefs, thoughts and assumptions
other_outcome.time_frame: Within one-week pre-delivery of relevant treatment module; within one-week post-delivery of relevant treatment module (varied time-frame)
Within one-week pre-delivery of relevant treatment module; within one-week post-delivery of relevant treatment module (varied time-frame)
other_outcome.description: Kentucky Inventory of Mindfulness Skills (KIMS; Baer, Smith, & Allen, 2004)

other_outcome.measure: Change in fear of physical anxiety sensations
other_outcome.time_frame: Within one-week pre-delivery of relevant treatment module; within one-week post-delivery of relevant treatment module (varied time-frame)
other_outcome.description: Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI; Reiss, Peterson, Gursky, & McNally 1986)

other_outcome.measure: Change in trauma-related beliefs and maladaptive appraisals of intrusive symptoms
other_outcome.time_frame: Within one-week pre-delivery of relevant treatment module; within one-week post-delivery of relevant treatment module (varied time-frame)
other_outcome.description: Posttraumatic cognitions inventory - short version (PTCI; Foa, Ehlers, Clark, Tolin, Orsillo, 1999)

other_outcome.measure: Change in implementation of cognitive therapy skills
other_outcome.time_frame: Within one-week pre-delivery of relevant treatment module; within one-week post-delivery of relevant treatment module (varied time-frame)

other_outcome.measure: Change in avoidance of internal experiences including thoughts, feelings, physical sensations.
other_outcome.time_frame: Within one-week pre-delivery of relevant treatment module; within one-week post-delivery of relevant treatment module (varied time-frame)
other_outcome.description: The Multidimensional Experiential Avoidance Questionnaire (Gamez, Chmielewski, Kotov, Ruggero, & Watson, 2011)

arm_group.arm_group_label: The Modular Protocol for Mental Health
arm_group.description: The Modular Protocol for Mental Health (Psychological Therapy) will last up to 18 regular weekly face-to-face sessions. Treatment follows a standard structured treatment session as per Cognitive Behavioural Therapy. The MPMH Treatment Manual was written by clinical psychologists. The selection and ordering of the modules for treatment will be delivered and determined by the Trial Clinical Psychologist in collaboration with the service-user. The treatment modules include: M1. Getting Acquainted M2. Understanding Emotions M3. Managing and Tolerating Emotions M4. Behavioural activation M5. Tackling Avoidance M6. Tackling Unhelpful Thoughts M7. Tackling Unhelpful Habits M8. Overcoming Repetitive Thinking M9. Managing Upsetting Memories and Images M10. Relapse Prevention and Future Orientation

For Treatment-as-usual (Psychological Therapy), clinicians will be asked to provide whatever treatment they deem appropriate, including psychological services, medication and referral to other services. TAU will be delivered by high-intensity therapists or clinical psychologists.

intervention.intervention_name: The Modular Protocol for Mental Health
intervention.description: This intervention is based on evidence-based cognitive-behavioural approaches to psychological disorders and offers a flexible approach to treatment delivery that targets the maladaptive processes common to mood and anxiety disorders.
intervention.arm_group_label: The Modular Protocol for Mental Health

intervention.description: This intervention will consist of psychological therapies delivered by high-intensity therapists or clinical psychologists.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a primary diagnosis of a unipolar mood, anxiety, stress or obsessive-compulsive disorder with at least one additional comorbid diagnosis according to the DSM-5. The criteria for diagnosis will be based on the Structured Clinical Interview for the DSM (SCID) which assesses disorders according to DSM-5 diagnostic criteria.
- To be eligible participants will also need to score >10 on either the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) or Generalised Anxiety Disorder -7 item scale, GAD-7 (see Study Measures above).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current/past psychosis or bipolar disorder
- Current full diagnosis of substance use disorder
- Organic brain damage
- Complex trauma history or recurrent self-injury requiring specialist services (as deemed by the NHS Clinical Care team)
- Current suicidality that warrants immediate clinical attention and constitutes a current risk of harm to the individual.

overall_official.affiliation: Medical Research Council Cognition and Brain Sciences Unit

facility.name: MRC Cognition and Brain Sciences Unit
